text: Hey <@U07EHBPLGLA> I'd reach out to support directly in the HubSpot portal.

So Ive also add a lot of issue with MS Teams webinar and HubSpot. 

MS webinar doesn't integrate like Zoom Webinar. It's all PowerShell. They also want you to register on their end, not HubSpot (form). 

So what I did for a customer was to use <http://SimpleEvents.io|SimpleEvents.io> in front of Teams Webinar. Then setting the Webinar to allow anyone to join. 

But the only way they join is via SimpleEvents and HubSpot.

Have you checked your private key log? 

What does the workflow action log say?

Hey, thanks for the reply. We actually figured this out. Someone had changed the permission/consent group, and no one had noticed.
A great suggestion would be getting a toast message or something saying like "The action succeeded but no email was sent due to XYZ"
